description: From Middle English verdure, from Old French verdure.

entries.meaning: The greenness of lush or growing vegetation; also: the vegetation itself.
examples: To her belonged Amber Spring, the water which gave verdure and beauty to the village and made living possible on that wild purple upland waste.

entries.meaning: (by extension) A condition of health and vigour.

verbs.description: verdure (third-person singular simple present verdures, present participle verduring, simple past and past participle verdured)
